questions.question: Electronic circuits designed to process one or more input signals and generate a defined output is ______________________ .

explanations.c: Logic gates are circuits that take one or more input signals and produce a specific output based on logic rules. They perform basic operations like AND, OR, and NOT in digital electronics.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a single stuck-at fault model in circuit testing?

explanations.b: Single stuck-at faults simulate defects like a wire stuck at 0 or 1 after fabrication. They help detect physical faults during post-manufacturing testing of digital circuits.

questions.question: 3. Which of the following are universal gates?
4. Output of XOR gate is high when—

answers.c: c. One of them is 1 other is 0 and vice versa

questions.question: 5. Output of E-XOR gate is high when—

answers.a: a. One input is low , other is high and vice versa.
answers.b: b. Only when both inputs are zero
answers.c: c. Either both inputs are 0 or both are 1
answers.d: d. Only when both inputs are 1
